description: Create an installation system for Ralph that allows easy setup in any repository with support for multiple AI tools

userStories.title: Create install.sh script with configuration options
userStories.description: As a developer, I want an install.sh script that accepts configuration flags so I can customize Ralph installation
acceptanceCriteria: install.sh accepts --target (directory to install into, default: current directory)
install.sh accepts --ralph-dir (where to create scripts/ralph, default: scripts/ralph)
install.sh accepts --tool (opencode|claude|codex, default: opencode)
install.sh accepts --max-iterations (default: 10)
install.sh accepts --help flag displaying usage instructions
install.sh validates that target directory is a git repository
install.sh checks if Ralph is already installed to prevent duplicate installs
install.sh has executable permissions
Typecheck passes for bash script (shellcheck)
userStories.notes: Shellcheck validation skipped as tool not available in environment

userStories.title: Implement file copying and directory setup
userStories.description: As a developer, I want files copied to target directory with proper structure so Ralph works immediately
acceptanceCriteria: install.sh creates target directory if it doesn't exist
install.sh creates ralph installation directory (scripts/ralph or custom)
install.sh creates plans/ directory with .gitkeep file
install.sh copies ralph.sh to target location
install.sh copies AGENTS.md to target location
install.sh copies prd.json.example to target location
install.sh makes ralph.sh executable (chmod +x)
install.sh appends Ralph-specific entries to target repo's .gitignore
install.sh validates all files were copied successfully

userStories.id: Add tool selection support to ralph.sh
userStories.description: As a developer, I want ralph.sh to support multiple AI tools (opencode, claude, codex) so I can use my preferred tool
acceptanceCriteria: ralph.sh reads RALPH_TOOL environment variable (default: opencode)
ralph.sh supports opencode with command: opencode run
ralph.sh supports claude with command: claude code --message
ralph.sh supports codex with command: codex exec
ralph.sh exits with error if unknown tool is specified
ralph.sh displays clear error message for unsupported tools
ralph.sh works with all three tools outputting to stdout and stderr
ralph.sh maintains existing iteration loop and SUCCESS detection logic

userStories.title: Create doctor.sh validation script
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a doctor.sh script that validates Ralph installation so I can verify everything works
acceptanceCriteria: doctor.sh checks that ralph.sh exists and is executable
doctor.sh checks that AGENTS.md exists in the ralph directory
doctor.sh checks that plans/ directory exists
doctor.sh checks that .gitignore contains Ralph entries
doctor.sh validates required CLI tool is installed (based on RALPH_TOOL)
doctor.sh tests ralph.sh runs successfully with --help or dry run
doctor.sh outputs clear PASS/FAIL status for each check
doctor.sh exits with non-zero code if any checks fail
doctor.sh provides helpful error messages for failures

userStories.title: Add interactive prompts and installation README
userStories.description: As a developer, I want interactive mode and local documentation so installation is user-friendly
acceptanceCriteria: install.sh prompts for installation directory if --ralph-dir not provided
install.sh prompts for AI tool selection (opencode/claude/codex) if --tool not provided
install.sh prompts for max iterations if not provided
install.sh generates README.md in target ralph directory with usage instructions
Generated README includes: configured tool information, quick start guide, example usage
install.sh displays success message with next steps after completion
install.sh shows progress updates during installation process
README.md includes link to main Ralph documentation

userStories.title: Add documentation and test installation with all tools
userStories.description: As a developer, I want comprehensive documentation and validated examples so the installation system is easy to use
acceptanceCriteria: install.sh --help displays detailed usage instructions
install.sh includes inline comments explaining key steps
install.sh creates valid bash script that passes shellcheck
Test installation with --tool opencode succeeds
Test installation with --tool claude succeeds
Test installation with --tool codex succeeds
doctor.sh validates installation for all three tools
Update main Ralph README.md to include installation instructions
Update AGENTS.md with installation system documentation
